fields.label: Page Layout Blocks
fields.name: page_layout_blocks
fields.instructions: Add rows of content here and drag and drop to reorder. Some of these parts use data set in Options > Global Template Parts

sub_fields.label: Max Width
sub_fields.name: single_col_max_width
sub_fields.instructions: set as a PERCENTAGE

sub_fields.label: Column Class
sub_fields.name: single_col_class
sub_fields.instructions: Add CSS classes here

sub_fields.label: Primary Column Class
sub_fields.name: two_col_primary_class
sub_fields.instructions: Add CSS classes here

sub_fields.label: Secondary Column Class
sub_fields.name: two_col_secondary_class
sub_fields.instructions: Add CSS classes here

sub_fields.label: Fixed width
sub_fields.name: fixed_width
sub_fields.instructions: Percentage

sub_fields.label: Title
sub_fields.name: title
sub_fields.instructions: HTML is okay.

sub_fields.label: Sub title
sub_fields.name: sub_title
sub_fields.instructions: HTML is okay.

sub_fields.label: HTML Tag
sub_fields.name: tag
sub_fields.instructions: Define the HTML tag to use

sub_fields.label: Class
sub_fields.name: class
sub_fields.instructions: Add a custom class to this title tag

choices.one-col: 1 column (can set max-container width on this option)
choices.two-col-fixed: 2 columns with fixed layout (primary content, aside)

sub_fields.label: Info
sub_fields.message: This layout is designed for using centered content. You can set a max container width in the single column content tab.

sub_fields.label: Info
sub_fields.message: Use this layout type to build in a standard 2-column layout. This matches the layout structure that you would find when using the 2-col page templates of this theme, except you have free reign over the sidebar area content.

sub_fields.label: Reverse two column layout?
sub_fields.name: two_col_fixed_reverse
sub_fields.instructions: If YES, the SECONDARY CONTENT will be on the left side on desktop screens. NOTE: the Primary Content will always stack first on mobile views.

sub_fields.label: Info
sub_fields.message: This is a flexible column setup where you can add up to six columns. You can set a fixed width per column if desired, otherwise all columns will be equal widths.

sub_fields.label: Enable vertical alignment?
sub_fields.name: flex_col_enable_vertical_alignment
sub_fields.instructions: If YES, the structure of these columns will be switched to "table layout". CAUTION: due to the nature of this, it's possible that elements with dynamic widths (like maps or carousels, etc) will spill out of their column.

sub_fields.label: Section ID
sub_fields.name: id
sub_fields.instructions: This element must have an ID set. If nothing is set here, an automatic ID will be set in the theme template.

sub_fields.label: Section Class
sub_fields.name: class
sub_fields.instructions: Set a custom class.

sub_fields.label: Stretch content to fullwidth?
sub_fields.name: stretch_content_to_fullwidth
sub_fields.instructions: if YES, this section won't use the standard content container. It will stretch to the edges of the browser window instead.

sub_fields.label: Background Image
sub_fields.name: background_image
sub_fields.instructions: NOTE: the image will be stretched beyond the container to fill the space

sub_fields.label: Background Overlay Opacity
sub_fields.name: background_overlay_opacity
sub_fields.instructions: set opacity 0 - 100%

sub_fields.label: USAGE NOTE
sub_fields.message: THESE ARE GLOBAL TEMPLATE PARTS. These parts aren't editable at the page level. To edit the content for each, go to the settings panel in Options > Global Template Parts

sub_fields.label: Choices
sub_fields.name: global_part
sub_fields.instructions: Choose a global part to display here.

sub_fields.label: Entry Points (post)
sub_fields.name: entry_points_obj
sub_fields.instructions: This element has a few layout style choices. Go to the DISPLAY Tab to select which style should be used for this block. Note that not all layout styles will use all of the data below.

sub_fields.label: Content Type
sub_fields.name: content_type
sub_fields.instructions: You can choose to have this block as just some arbitrary text, instead of a the standard entry point, if required.

sub_fields.label: Select Page to Link
sub_fields.name: select_page_to_link
sub_fields.instructions: Select the content you want to promote with this entry point

sub_fields.label: Customize
sub_fields.name: customize_defaults
sub_fields.instructions: By default, this will pull the page title and image of your selected page into the layout. You can override those settings here and add new things if desired.

sub_fields.label: Add sub text
sub_fields.name: subtitle
sub_fields.instructions: Arbitrary text below the main title. HTML is okay.

sub_fields.label: Background Color
sub_fields.name: bg_color
sub_fields.instructions: If no image, set a background color

sub_fields.label: Title
sub_fields.name: title
sub_fields.instructions: HTML is okay.

sub_fields.label: Sub title
sub_fields.name: sub_title
sub_fields.instructions: HTML is okay.

sub_fields.label: HTML Tag
sub_fields.name: tag
sub_fields.instructions: Define the HTML tag to use

sub_fields.label: Class
sub_fields.name: class
sub_fields.instructions: Add a custom class to this title tag

sub_fields.label: Layout Reference
sub_fields.message: Style A: Style B: Style C: Style D:

sub_fields.label: Background Image
sub_fields.name: background_image
sub_fields.instructions: NOTE: the image will be stretched beyond the container to fill the space

sub_fields.label: Background Overlay Opacity
sub_fields.name: background_overlay_opacity
sub_fields.instructions: set opacity 0 - 100%

sub_fields.label: Post Type
sub_fields.name: post_type
sub_fields.instructions: Type in the post type handle here. Default: post

sub_fields.label: Exclude IDs
sub_fields.name: exclude_ids
sub_fields.instructions: a comma-separated list of IDs you don't want to include

sub_fields.label: Button below posts
sub_fields.name: button
sub_fields.instructions: Can be used as a "view more" button if applicable.

sub_fields.label: Title
sub_fields.name: title
sub_fields.instructions: HTML is okay.

sub_fields.label: Sub title
sub_fields.name: sub_title
sub_fields.instructions: HTML is okay.

sub_fields.label: HTML Tag
sub_fields.name: tag
sub_fields.instructions: Define the HTML tag to use

sub_fields.label: Class
sub_fields.name: class
sub_fields.instructions: Add a custom class to this title tag

sub_fields.label: Layout
sub_fields.name: layout_template
sub_fields.instructions:
ADVANCED: Specify a content template filename for the post listings. The template name must be relative to the theme directory. DO NOT INCLUDE a forward slash at the beginning.

ex. "template-parts/layouts/my-content-file"

sub_fields.label: Columns
sub_fields.name: columns
sub_fields.instructions: Choose the number of items per row. Default: 3

sub_fields.label: USAGE NOTES
sub_fields.message: This is a fullwidth block that will display the content in two "halves" set at a 1:1 ratio (square). It's intended for small bits of content that will contrast each other side-by-side. If the content is too long, it may pop out of the box.

sub_fields.label: Column Background Image
sub_fields.name: col_1_bg_image
sub_fields.instructions: Set a background image for this block. (The image will be cropped and set to cover the background, so don't depend on complete control over the display)

sub_fields.label: Background Overlay Opacity
sub_fields.name: col_1_bg_overlay_opacity
sub_fields.instructions: Enter as a PERCENTAGE, 0-100

sub_fields.label: Column Class
sub_fields.name: col_1_class
sub_fields.instructions: Can use preset classnames like: text-left, text-center, text-right to easily control the alignment per column.

sub_fields.label: Link entire box
sub_fields.name: col_1_box_link
sub_fields.instructions: If you set a link here, it will span the whole box and make it clickable. IMPORTANT! Do not include a link in the content above in unison with this link or it will break the section.

sub_fields.label: Column Background Image
sub_fields.name: col_2_bg_image
sub_fields.instructions: Set a background image for this block. (The image will be cropped and set to cover the background, so don't depend on complete control over the display)

sub_fields.label: Background Overlay Opacity
sub_fields.name: col_2_bg_overlay_opacity_copy
sub_fields.instructions: Enter as a PERCENTAGE, 0-100

sub_fields.label: Column Class
sub_fields.name: col_2_class
sub_fields.instructions: Can use preset classnames like: text-left, text-center, text-right to easily control the alignment per column.

sub_fields.label: Link entire box
sub_fields.name: col_2_box_link
sub_fields.instructions: If you set a link here, it will span the whole box and make it clickable. IMPORTANT! Do not include a link in the content above in unison with this link or it will break the section.

sub_fields.label: Expand to fullwidth?
sub_fields.name: expand_to_fullwidth
sub_fields.instructions: If YES, this content will expand to the edges of the browser. If NO, it will be contained by the theme's standard content container.

sub_fields.label: Reverse columns for desktop?
sub_fields.name: reverse_columns_for_desktop
sub_fields.instructions: By default, Column 1 will stack first on mobile. You can set this option to force Column 2 to the left side though on desktop views.

sub_fields.label: IMPORTANT!
sub_fields.message: Only use one of these galleries per page. Having multiple can hurt site performance and load times.

sub_fields.label: Title
sub_fields.name: title
sub_fields.instructions: HTML is okay.

sub_fields.name: sub_title
sub_fields.instructions: HTML is okay.

sub_fields.name: tag
sub_fields.instructions: Define the HTML tag to use

sub_fields.label: Class
sub_fields.name: class
sub_fields.instructions: Add a custom class to this title tag

sub_fields.label: Section ID
sub_fields.name: id
sub_fields.instructions: REQUIRED. This element must of an ID set.

sub_fields.label: Section Class
sub_fields.name: class
sub_fields.instructions: Set a custom class.
